intro: Lonchomera leptopoda, commonly known as the slender leaf lonchomera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
